conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and relationships in the figure
State A: VA = V0, TA = T0, PA = P0; State B: VB = 2V0, TB = ?, PB = ?; State C: VC = ?, TC = ?, PC = ?
Pressure at state B is doubled to keep PV constant, so PB = 2P0
Determine temperature at state B: TB = 4T0
Extension of BC over origin implies isothermal process from C to B
From state A to state C, PC VC = P0 V0; process from C to B is isothermal, PC VC = PB VB
Calculate pressure at state C: PC = 8P0
Determine temperature at state C: TC = 4T0
